notes.text: • NOTE • An Abnormal Engine Start occurs when:
• there is a failure to accelerate after 30 seconds, or
• there is no N1 indication at 25% N2, or
• there is low oil pressure after start, or
• ITT exceeds limits (red line).

steps.text: If passenger oxygen masks do not deploy:

notes.text: • NOTE • Refer to Section 2: Limitations, 'Oxygen' for oxygen requirements.

If the CABIN PRESSURE DUMP is not activated, Emergency Descent Mode (EDM) will activate if the aircraft is at or above 14,900 feet pressure altitude and the cabin altitude is greater than or equal to 15,000 feet. An EDM activation can lead to an automatic activation of Safe Return Autoland. EDM and Safe Return Autoland will not automatically activate if CABIN PRESSURE DUMP is activated. Manual activation of Safe Return Autoland can still be accomplished following CABIN PRESSURE DUMP activation.

steps.action: ADJUST TO NORM IF ABLE AND BELOW 20,000 FEET

steps.text: If airflow is not sufficient to clear smoke or fumes:

warnings.text: • WARNING • The fire extinguisher should only be used in 2-second blasts, and additional shots should only be used if necessary to extinguish the fire. Inhalation of the complete discharge of the fire extinguisher may result in cardiotoxicity and/or anesthetic effects to the occupants. Occupants shall use emergency oxygen masks during and after fire extinguisher use.

notes.text: • NOTE • With BAT and GEN switches OFF, engine will continue to run. However, no electrical power will be available.

If the airplane is in IMC, turn GEN 1, GEN 2, and BAT 1 switches OFF. Power from Battery 2 will power all the loads on the Emergency Bus for at least 60 minutes. If airplane is in day VFR conditions and turning off the GEN switches eliminated the fire situation, leave the GEN switches OFF.
If the cause of the fire is readily apparent and accessible, use the fire extinguisher to extinguish flames and land as soon as possible.

If required to re-activate systems, pause several seconds between activating each system to isolate malfunctioning system. Continue flight to earliest possible landing with malfunctioning system OFF. Activate only the minimum amount of equipment necessary to complete a safe landing.
Refer to Section 2: Limitations, "Oxygen" for oxygen requirements.

steps.text: • WARNING • The recommended CAPS activation speed is one that is less than 135 KIAS and 145 KTAS, whichever is lower, which will result in immediate parachute deployment once the CAPS handle is pulled. It is important for the operator to make all reasonable efforts to slow to the minimum possible airspeed prior to CAPS activation.

If CAPS is activated at speeds higher than 135 KIAS and 145 KTAS, whichever is lower, the system is designed to delay deployment of the parachute until the autopilot slows the airplane to the parachute deployment envelope. Do not attempt to overpower or disconnect the autopilot. The time required for the autopilot to slow the airplane from 250 KIAS to the parachute deployment airspeed has been demonstrated to be approximately 15-24 seconds. Flying at a slower airspeed when CAPS is activated will reduce this time.
If the airspeed is still above the maximum deployment speed approximately 30 seconds after CAPS activation, the system will automatically deploy the parachute.
CAPS deployment will likely result in damage or loss to the airframe and possible injury to the aircraft occupants. Seat belts must be worn at all times.

Jerking or rapidly pulling the CAPS activation handle will greatly increase the pull forces required to activate the rocket. Use a firm and steady pulling motion – a “chin-up” type pull ensures successful activation.

steps.action: PULL DOWN STEADILY WITH BOTH HANDS

steps.text: • NOTE • Wait for plane to stabilize beneath canopy before proceeding.

warnings.text: • WARNING • If all attempts to restart the engine fail and a forced landing is imminent, select a suitable landing site and prepare for landing. As forced landings on unimproved surfaces are not recommended, CAPS activation may be the safest option.
Refer to Section 3: Emergency Procedures, "CAPS Activation" checklist.
Refer to Section 10: Safety Information, "Cirrus Airframe Parachute System (CAPS)" for CAPS deployment scenarios and landing considerations.

When determined that a forced landing is the safest option, a suitable landing site should be chosen as early as possible so that maximum time will be available to plan and execute the forced landing. While gliding, be aware that use of flaps will reduce glide distance. Flaps should not be selected until landing is assured. Land on the main gear and hold the nose wheel off the ground as long as possible.

emergencies.title: ENGINE FAILURE ON TAKEOFF - LOW ALTITUDE
emergencies.description: Engine failure at low altitude after takeoff.

warnings.text: • WARNING • If engine failure is accompanied by fuel fumes in the cockpit, or if internal engine damage is suspected, lift the guard on the ENGINE FIRE ACKNOWLEDGE switch, toggle the switch, and shut down the engine. Do not attempt a restart.

If the engine fails immediately after becoming airborne, abort on the runway if possible. In most cases, when the engine fails below 500 feet AGL, the landing should be made straight ahead, turning only to avoid obstructions. In such a case, lower the nose to maintain flying airspeed and establish a glide attitude. After establishing a glide for landing, perform as many of the checklist items as time permits.

notes.text: • NOTE • When determined that a forced landing is the safest option, a suitable landing site should be chosen as early as possible so that maximum time will be available to plan and execute the forced landing.

While gliding, be aware that use of flaps will reduce glide distance. Flaps should not be selected until landing is assured. Land on the main gear and hold the nose wheel off the ground as long as possible.

notes.text: • NOTE • This condition is identified by complete loss of thrust accompanied by the following:
1. Loud bangs, knocks, vibration, or other noise, or
2. Engine Fire Indication (CAS Warning and/or FIRE light), or
3. Fire Detector Fail (CAS Caution), or
4. Erratic engine indications, such as the following:
• Indication failure/loss of indication
• Low or no N1 or N2
• Low fuel pressure
• Low or no oil pressure
• High ITT, fuel flow, or oil temperature

Failure of the gear sensors to provide proper indication could cause the LDG GEAR FAIL Caution to display.

notes.text: • NOTE • Rudder effectiveness will decrease with decreasing airspeed.

warnings.text: • WARNING • If a flat tire is suspected, do not retract landing gear since it may cause difficulties in extending the gear. Additionally, landings with the gear up are potentially more hazardous than with the gear down. The probability of aircraft damage is greater with gear up landings.

If a flat tire or tread separation occurs during takeoff and it is not possible to abort, land as soon as practicable. Tread separation could damage wing-mounted fuel system components. Continued flight could result in fuel imbalance or fuel exhaustion. A significant imbalance and/or exhaustion can result in loss of aircraft due to loss of control or loss of thrust leading to an off-airport landing.

steps.text: If main gear tire is flat:

steps.step: a. Land on the side of the runway corresponding to the good tire.
b. Maintain directional control with the brakes, rudder, and aileron.
c. Do not taxi. Stop the airplane and perform a normal Engine Shutdown.

steps.text: If nose gear tire is flat:

steps.step: a. Land in the center of the runway.
b. Hold the nosewheel off the ground as long as possible.
c. Do not taxi. Stop the airplane and perform a normal Engine Shutdown.

notes.text: • NOTE • Dispatch is not authorized with inoperative GPS, predicted degraded GPS (RAIM prediction), or known GPS outage (NOTAM) expected during the planned flight.
Red PTCH annunciator on PFD.

• NOTE • If the pitch axis fails while autopilot is engaged, the autopilot will disengage as indicated by the red AP flashing on the PFD. The autopilot may be re-engaged; however, vertical Flight Director modes must be hand flown.
This condition will likely be accompanied by a “STICK PUSHER FAIL” CAS message.
Red ROLL annunciator on PFD.
• NOTE • If the roll axis fails while autopilot is engaged, the autopilot will disengage as indicated by the red AP flashing on the PFD. The autopilot may not be re-engaged.
ESP is inoperative.
Red YAW annunciator on PFD.

• NOTE • The yaw damper will disconnect, but the autopilot may still be used for vertical and lateral guidance. Some lateral mistrim may become apparent, and manual rudder inputs may be required for turn coordination.

cautionAF.title: AOA FAIL Caution
cautionAF.description: AOA signal invalid.

steps.step: 2. Avoid stalls, low airspeed, and uncoordinated or abrupt control inputs.

warnings.text: • WARNING • The aircraft is not stall protected. Stalls must be avoided when the AOA is inoperative. Excessive altitude loss may result if the aircraft is stalled. Departure from controlled flight or spin may occur during stall with uncoordinated aileron/rudder inputs.
Stall warning is not operative or reliable.
Stick pusher is not operative or reliable.
Expect STALL WARNING FAIL or STICK PUSHER FAIL CAS.
Stall speeds in turns or increased load factor are higher.

notes.text: • NOTE • Green donut airspeed reference will be unavailable or unreliable.

cautionAF.title: AOA HEAT FAIL Caution
cautionAF.description: AOA heat failure.

notes.text: • NOTE • In case of AOA heat failure during flight in icing conditions, AOA measurements may be erroneous.
Refer to VREF Speeds table.

cautionAF.title: AOA HEAT FAIL Caution
cautionAF.description: AOA heat failure.

notes.text: • NOTE • In case of AOA heat failure during flight in icing conditions, AOA measurements may be erroneous.
Refer to VREF Speeds table.

cautionAF.title: BLEED AIR Caution
cautionAF.description: ECS bleed air system pressure low or failed.

steps.step: a. Land as soon as practicable.

cautionAF.title: BLEED LEAK Caution
cautionAF.description: Bleed leak detected in tailcone.

steps.step: a. Descend and land as soon as practicable.

steps.text: • NOTE • Cabin pressurization is no longer functional.

steps.step: a. Perform Emergency Descent checklist as required.
c. Land as soon as possible.

notes.text: • NOTE • Refer to Section 2: Limitations, "Oxygen" for oxygen requirements.

cautionAF.title: BLEED OFF Caution
cautionAF.description: Bleed air is switched to OFF/FRESH.

steps.text: If bleed is not desired OFF:

steps.step: (2) Monitor for CABIN ALTITUDE HIGH Warning.

cautionAF.title: BLEED OPEN Caution
cautionAF.description: Shutoff solenoid failed to close.

cautionAF.title: BLEED OVERPRESSURE Caution
cautionAF.description: ECS bleed air system pressure high.

steps.step: b. Land as soon as practicable.

cautionAF.title: CABIN LFE NOT SET Caution
cautionAF.description: Landing field elevation is not set.

steps.step: 1. Input destination airport in flight plan.
2. Manually set Landing Field Elevation on GTC.

cautionAF.title: CABIN PRESSURE CTRL FAIL Caution
cautionAF.description: Detected failure of CPCS Controller.

steps.step: 2. Monitor for CABIN ALTITUDE HIGH Warning.

notes.text: • NOTE • If cabin pressure controller fails, CPCS will maintain current cabin altitude.

cautionAF.title: DOOR OPEN EMER EXIT Caution
cautionAF.description: Emergency exit door is open.

warnings.text: • WARNING • Stay clear of window if malfunction is believed to have occurred. Ensure seat belts are tightened and secured in order to avoid extraction from aircraft in the event of rapid door opening/decompression. Do not attempt to latch or unlatch the exit door or manipulate the exit door or latch.

steps.step: a. Visually check window latch handle position.
b. Land as soon as practicable.

cautionAF.title: ECS BLEED HOT Caution
cautionAF.description: Bleed supply temperature is too hot.

notes.text: • NOTE • This CAS message is displayed when bleed supply temperature reaches 250 °F (121 °C).

cautionAF.title: ECS BLEED OVERHEAT Caution
cautionAF.description: Bleed supply temperature is too hot.

steps.step: ❑ If message persists or if TCV CONTROL FAIL is displayed:
(e) Monitor for CABIN ALTITUDE HIGH Warning.

notes.text: • NOTE • This CAS message is displayed when bleed supply temperature reaches 270 °F (132 °C).
Refer to Section 2: Limitations, "Oxygen" for oxygen requirements.

cautionAF.title: ECS CONTROL FAIL Caution
cautionAF.description:
ECS controller has failed, OR
All cabin temperature sensors have failed, OR
All ECS fans in cabin have failed, OR
Bleed duct temperature sensor has failed.

steps.step: 3. Monitor for ECS BLEED OVERHEAT Caution.
4. Perform ECS BLEED OVERHEAT Caution checklist, if required.

cautionAF.title: ECS TEMP BACKUP Caution
cautionAF.description: Environmental control temperature backup mode.

steps.text: If TEMP BACKUP mode engaged intentionally:

steps.step: b. Monitor for ECS BLEED HOT or ECS BLEED OVERHEAT cautions.
❍ If ECS BLEED HOT is displayed:
(1) Perform ECS BLEED HOT caution checklist.
❍ If ECS BLEED OVERHEAT is displayed:
(1) Perform ECS BLEED OVERHEAT caution checklist.

steps.text: If TEMP BACKUP mode engaged unintentionally:

notes.text: • NOTE • When in Temp Backup mode, changes in thrust and aircraft speed affect incoming bleed air temperature.
Prior to increasing thrust or reducing aircraft speed, it is recommended that the temperature setting be lowered (especially during low altitude level off, landing, and go-around conditions).

cautionAF.title: EMER BATTERY FAIL Caution
cautionAF.description: Emergency battery (Bat 2) service is required.

steps.step: 1. Exit IMC as soon as practicable.

cautions.text: • CAUTION • Emergency battery may be unavailable.

notes.text: • NOTE • Battery FAIL indicates an internal condition which reduces capability of the battery. Possible conditions include a faulty temperature sensor, disconnected heater, etc.

cautionAF.title: EMER BATTERY FAULT Caution
cautionAF.description: Emergency battery (Bat 2) fault detected.

steps.step: b. Service aircraft as soon as practicable.
a. Exit IMC as soon as practicable.
b. Land as soon as practicable.

cautions.text: • CAUTION • Emergency battery is unavailable.

notes.text: • NOTE • Battery FAULT indicates a condition causing battery to disable charging and/or discharging until corrected. Possible conditions include under-voltage, over-voltage, over-current, short-circuit, and over-temperature.

cautionAF.title: ENGINE START BAT TEMP Caution
cautionAF.description: Main battery (Bat 1) is below minimum start temp.

steps.step: 1. Wait until message extinguishes before attempting start.

cautions.text: • CAUTION • If start is attempted prior to message extinguishing, the battery may be temporarily inoperative, or it may result in an engine hot start or other faults.

cautionAF.title: ENGINE START VOLTS Caution - On Ground
cautionAF.description: Main battery (Bat 1) insufficient charge for reliable engine start.

notes.text: • NOTE • Avoid prolonged battery-only ground operation beyond 20 minutes combined operation, which may result in insufficient capacity for engine start.
Attempted start with insufficient battery capacity may result in battery low voltage protection circuit activation, which will temporarily make main battery unavailable.
Condition will automatically recover after main battery is adequately recharged.

steps.step: 1. Battery service, preheat and/or charging is required.

cautionAF.title: ESS BUS VOLTS Caution
cautionAF.description:
Essential power bus voltage is low, OR
Loss of forward essential power bus voltage.

steps.step: 1. Perform GENERATOR 1 CURRENT Caution and GENERATOR 2 CURRENT Caution Checklists.

notes.text: • NOTE • Indicates GEN 1 and GEN 2 failure and is associated with low Main Bus and Essential Bus voltages, GEN 1 and GEN 2 current indications, BAT 1 and BAT 2 discharge, and GEN 1 and GEN 2 Cautions.

cautionAF.title: EXTERNAL POWER CONNECTED Caution - On Ground
cautionAF.description: External power is connected.

steps.step: 1. Ensure external power is removed before moving airplane.

notes.text: • NOTE • Indicates external power is connected.

cautionAF.title: FADEC NO DISPATCH Caution
cautionAF.description: Reference FADEC Fault Code Messages.

steps.step: a. Allow sufficient time for ice to clear from inlet probes.
a. From Home, touch Aircraft Systems.
b. Touch the FADEC Stale Fault Reset Button.
a. Continuance of flight is permitted.

notes.text: • NOTE • Consider selecting a destination where the necessary FADEC maintenance can be performed. Failure to do so will prevent further dispatch.

cautionAF.title: FIRE DETECTOR FAIL Caution
cautionAF.description: Engine fire detector loop low pressure.

steps.step: a. Land as soon as practicable.

cautionAF.title: FIRE EXT LOW L-R Caution
cautionAF.description: Pressure is low in both fire extinguishers.

warnings.text: • WARNING • May result in limited/reduced fire suppressant capability.

steps.step: a. Land as soon as practicable.

cautionAF.title: FLAPS AIRSPEED INHIBIT Caution
cautionAF.description: Flaps motion inhibited.

cautionAF.title: FLAPS DISAGREE Caution
cautionAF.description: Flaps are not within commanded position limits.

warnings.text: • WARNING • Flaps motion is inhibited when a flap position disagree condition exists.

steps.step: b. Perform Flaps Inoperative Approach/Landing checklist.

cautionAF.title: FLAPS FAIL Caution
cautionAF.description:
Flaps system inoperative, OR
Flaps position sensor miscompare, OR
Flaps sensors failed, position unknown, OR
Flaps have not reached the selected position.

steps.step: 1. Place flaps in last known or safe position.
a. Perform Flaps Inoperative Approach/Landing checklist.

cautionAF.title: FLAPS SELECTOR FAIL Caution
cautionAF.description: Cannot determine flaps selector position.

cautionAF.title: FLIGHT IDLE FAIL Caution
cautionAF.description: Engine idle N2 is too low.

cautions.text: • CAUTION • When N2 < 70%, Engine IPS and Wing/Stab IPS will be degraded.

notes.text: • NOTE • If N2 < 70%, expect increased engine/go-around thrust acceleration time.

cautionAF.title: FUEL IMBALANCE Caution
cautionAF.description: Fuel imbalance is ≥ 15 Gallons.

steps.step: a. Refer to EIS for fuel quantity (based on level sensors).

steps.text: If message extinguishes or imbalance decreases:
If message persists or imbalance increases:

steps.step: a. Land as soon as possible.

notes.text: • NOTE • To maintain fuel balance, monitor fuel quantity and alternate LEFT/RIGHT selection as needed.

cautionAF.title: EXTERNAL POWER CONNECTED Caution
cautionAF.description: External power is connected.

steps.step: 1. Ensure external power is removed before moving airplane.

notes.text: • NOTE • Indicates external power is connected.

cautionAF.title: FADEC NO DISPATCH Caution
cautionAF.description: Reference FADEC Fault Code Messages.

steps.step: a. Allow sufficient time for ice to clear from inlet probes.
a. From Home, touch Aircraft Systems.
b. Touch the FADEC Stale Fault Reset Button.
a. Continuance of flight is permitted.

notes.text: • NOTE • Consider selecting a destination where the necessary FADEC maintenance can be performed. Failure to do so will prevent further dispatch.

cautionAF.title: FIRE DETECTOR FAIL Caution
cautionAF.description: Engine fire detector loop low pressure.

steps.step: a. Land as soon as practicable.

cautionAF.title: FIRE EXT LOW L-R Caution
cautionAF.description: Pressure is low in both fire extinguishers.

warnings.text: • WARNING • May result in limited/reduced fire suppressant capability.

steps.step: a. Land as soon as practicable.

cautionAF.title: FIRE EXT LOW L Advisory
cautionAF.description: Pressure is low in the left fire extinguisher.

steps.step: 2. Service aircraft as soon as practical.

cautionAF.title: FIRE EXT LOW R Advisory
cautionAF.description: Pressure is low in the right fire extinguisher.

steps.step: 2. Service aircraft as soon as practical.

cautionAF.title: FLAPS AIRSPEED INHIBIT Caution
cautionAF.description: Flaps motion inhibited.

cautionAF.title: FLAPS DISAGREE Caution
cautionAF.description: Flaps are not within commanded position limits.

warnings.text: • WARNING • Flaps motion is inhibited when a flap position disagree condition exists.

steps.step: b. Perform Flaps Inoperative Approach/Landing checklist.

cautionAF.title: FLAPS FAIL Caution
cautionAF.description:
Flaps system inoperative, OR
Flaps position sensor miscompare, OR
Flaps sensors failed, position unknown, OR
Flaps have not reached the selected position.

steps.step: 1. Place flaps in last known or safe position.
a. Perform Flaps Inoperative Approach/Landing checklist.

cautionAF.title: FLAPS SELECTOR FAIL Caution
cautionAF.description: Cannot determine flaps selector position.

cautionAF.title: FLIGHT IDLE FAIL Caution
cautionAF.description: Engine idle N2 is too low.

cautions.text: • CAUTION • When N2 < 70%, Engine IPS and Wing/Stab IPS will be degraded.

notes.text: • NOTE • If N2 < 70%, expect increased engine/go-around thrust acceleration time.

cautionAF.title: FUEL IMBALANCE Caution
cautionAF.description: Fuel imbalance is ≥ 15 Gallons.

steps.step: a. Refer to EIS for fuel quantity (based on level sensors).

steps.text: If message extinguishes or imbalance decreases:
If message persists or imbalance increases:

steps.step: a. Land as soon as possible.

notes.text: • NOTE • To maintain fuel balance, monitor fuel quantity and alternate LEFT/RIGHT selection as needed.

cautionAF.title: FUEL LOW LEFT/RIGHT/TOTAL Caution
cautionAF.description:
Left fuel quantity is low, OR
Right fuel quantity is low, OR
Total fuel quantity is low.

notes.text: • NOTE • AUTO Fuel Control will continue to balance fuel consumption during FUEL LOW LEFT/RIGHT/TOTAL caution.

cautionAF.title: FUEL PUMP FAIL Caution
cautionAF.description: Fuel pump has failed.

cautionAF.title: FUEL PUMP ON Caution
cautionAF.description: Fuel pump is ON due to low fuel pressure.

steps.step: a. Refer to EIS for current tank selection (AUTO selection shown in white; LEFT/RIGHT selection shown in cyan).

steps.text: If message extinguishes and does not reappear:

steps.step: c. Land as soon as practicable.

notes.text: • NOTE • Message indicates pump has been activated and latched ON. Latch is removed by setting the Fuel Control Switch to LEFT or RIGHT, then to AUTO.
To maintain fuel balance, monitor fuel quantity and alternate LEFT/RIGHT selection as needed.

cautionAF.title: FUEL PUMP ON Advisory
cautionAF.description: Fuel pump is ON for normal operations.

steps.step: 1. Advisory only. No further action required.

notes.text: • NOTE • Fuel pump has been activated due to normal operations, either due to pilot action (selecting L or R tank) or by the avionics due to entering Start Mode.

cautionAF.title: FUEL QTY MISCOMPARE Caution
cautionAF.description: Sensed and totalized fuel quantity disagreement.

steps.step: a. Refer to EIS for fuel quantity (based on level sensors).

cautionAF.title: FUEL SELECTOR FAIL Caution
cautionAF.description: Cannot determine fuel selector position.

steps.text: If control is inoperable in all switch positions:

steps.step: a. Land as soon as possible.

steps.text: • CAUTION • A failed Fuel Control Switch will cause a fuel imbalance which will increase with continued flight.
If LEFT and RIGHT Switch positions are operable:

steps.action: FULLEST TANK, LEFT OR RIGHT ONLY

steps.step: d. Land as soon as possible.

notes.text: • NOTE • To maintain fuel balance, monitor fuel quantity, and alternate LEFT/RIGHT selection as needed.

cautionAF.title: FUEL SHUTOFF FAIL Caution
cautionAF.description: Fuel shutoff valve not in commanded position.

steps.text: If during normal flight and engine is running:

steps.step: a. Land as soon as practicable.

steps.text: If airborne, and engine has shut down:
If during Engine Fire In Flight Checklist:

steps.step: b. Continue with Engine Fire In Flight Checklist.

cautionAF.title: FUEL TEMP LOW Caution
cautionAF.description: Fuel temperature is low, increase OAT.

steps.step: a. Climb or descend to warmer conditions.

steps.text: • NOTE • Change altitude to increase OAT and increase fuel temperature. Due to temperature inversion, warmer temperatures may be at a higher altitude and cooler temperatures may be at a lower altitude.

steps.step: a. Warm aircraft to increase fuel temperature.

cautionAF.title: FUEL VALVE #1 FAIL Caution
cautionAF.description: Fuel Control Valve #1 has failed.

cautions.text: • CAUTION • Avoid AUTO selection, which will draw fuel through Fuel Valve #1 (which has failed).

notes.text: • NOTE • To maintain fuel balance, monitor fuel quantity and alternate LEFT/RIGHT selection as needed.

cautionAF.title: FUEL VALVE #2 FAIL Caution
cautionAF.description: Fuel Control Valve #2 has failed.

notes.text: • NOTE • The Fuel Control Switch should remain in AUTO position which draws fuel through Fuel Valve #1 which is operating normally. See EIS Display for selected valve position (AUTO).
Avoid using LEFT or RIGHT selection which activates the electric fuel pump and draws fuel through Fuel Valve #2 which has failed.

cautionAF.title: FUEL VALVE AUTO FAIL Caution
cautionAF.description: Auto fuel tank selection failure, use Manual mode.

notes.text: • NOTE • To maintain fuel balance, monitor fuel quantity and alternate LEFT/RIGHT selection as needed.

steps.step: a. From Home, touch Aircraft Systems.
b. Touch the GCU Reset Button.

steps.text: If GEN 1 does not reset (low GEN 1 Current and Main Bus voltage):

steps.step: (2) Land as soon as practicable, avoiding IMC or night flight as able (reduced power redundancy).

notes.text: • NOTE • With Battery 1 and Generator 1 switched off, power will be removed from the entire main bus, including the hydraulic powerpack. The following equipment will also be inoperative:
• Landing gear control (to lower landing gear, perform Alternate Gear Extension checklist)
• ECS (such as AC Compressor and Fans)
• Redundant equipment (such as Fuel Valve 2 and AHRS 2 / ADC 2)
• Non-essential equipment (such as Electric Fuel Pump, Stick Shaker, Yaw SAS, Avionics Fan, Nose Landing Lights, and IFE USB)
• Optional equipment (such as Traffic/TCAS, Transponder2, Radar, EVS, 115VAC PWR, and Iridium WIFI Data)

steps.text: If GEN 2 does not reset (low GEN 2 current):
• NOTE • GEN 1 will support GEN 2 electrical loads.

steps.step: b. Land as soon as practicable, avoiding IMC or night flight as able (reduced power redundancy).

cautionGZ.title: GROUND IDLE FAIL Caution - On Ground

cautions.text: • CAUTION • With increased idle speed, idle thrust will be greater than normal. To prevent overheating of brakes, exercise proper taxiing techniques.

notes.text: • NOTE • Idle speed is high for ground operation.
Refer to Section 10: Safety Information, "Taxiing, Steering, and Braking Practices".

cautionGZ.title: HYDRAULIC OVERHEAT Caution
cautionGZ.description: Landing gear hydraulic power pack has overheated.

steps.text: If HYDRAULIC OVERHEAT Caution CAS is accompanied by LDG GEAR FAIL Caution CAS:

steps.step: a. Refer to LDG GEAR FAIL Caution checklist.

steps.text: If HYDRAULIC OVERHEAT Caution CAS is not accompanied by LDG GEAR FAIL Caution CAS:

steps.step: b. Wait 2-3 minutes for HYDRAULIC OVERHEAT CAS message to extinguish.
❍ If HYDRAULIC OVERHEAT CAS message extinguishes:
(1) Perform Alternate Gear Extension checklist, as required.
❍ If HYDRAULIC OVERHEAT CAS message persists, power pack may still be operating continuously:
(3) Perform Alternate Gear Extension checklist, as required.

notes.text: • NOTE • FUEL VALVE #2 FAIL Caution CAS will be periodically displayed during normal tank AUTO selection since the secondary valve is not powered by emergency power.

With Battery 1 and Generator 1 switched off, power will be removed from the entire main bus, including the hydraulic powerpack. Landing gear control will also be inoperative. To lower landing gear, perform Alternate Gear Extension checklist.
• NOTE • This CAS message is displayed when the WING/STAB IPS Switch is selected ON without the ENGINE IPS Switch being selected ON.

cautionGZ.title: IPS ENG INLET ON Caution
cautionGZ.description:
Engine IPS should be off, OR
Shutoff solenoid failed to close.

steps.text: If Engine IPS should be off:
If shutoff solenoid failed to close:

cautions.text: • CAUTION • Operation above temperature limitations may result in IPS ENG INLET OVERHEAT Caution.

cautionGZ.title: IPS ENG INLET OVERHEAT Caution
cautionGZ.description:
Inlet temp higher than required for anti-ice, OR
Inlet temp higher than safe levels.

steps.step: c. Reduce thrust as necessary to extinguish message.

cautionGZ.title: IPS FLUID LOW Caution
cautionGZ.description: Less than 15 minutes of IPS fluid remaining.

notes.text: • NOTE • This CAS message is displayed when IPS fluid quantity ≤ 0.2 U.S. gallon (0.8 L).

cautionGZ.title: IPS WINDSHLD TIMER Caution
cautionGZ.description: Loss of WS/Rad pump automatic timer control.

cautionGZ.title: IPS WING/STAB FAIL Caution
cautionGZ.description:
Wing/Stabilizer IPS low system pressure, OR
Wing/Stabilizer IPS zonal pressure failure, OR
Wing/Stabilizer IPS controller failure, OR
Low system pressure, Wing/Stab IPS inoperative.

cautionGZ.title: IPS WING/STAB TEMP LOW Caution
cautionGZ.description: Min temp for boot operation is -40 °F.

cautionGZ.title: LDG GEAR FAIL Caution
cautionGZ.description: Landing gear didn't reach the selected position.

steps.text:
• NOTE • Even though the gear assemblies are functioning properly, the root cause may be a failure of the gear sensors to indicate properly (Down/Up or Locked/Unlocked).
Reversing the landing gear handle to the opposite position clears the inhibit of the hydraulic power pack enable (limited to 30 seconds of continuous operation).

steps.step: a. Monitor for HYDRAULIC OVERHEAT Caution.
b. Perform visual verification of gear position by ATC (towered airport), if possible.
c. Perform Alternate Gear Extension checklist.

cautionGZ.title: LDG GEAR SELECTOR FAIL Caution
cautionGZ.description: Cannot determine landing gear selector position.

steps.text: If message persists and landing gear is down:

steps.step: a. Do not cycle landing gear.
b. Land as soon as practicable.

steps.text: If message persists and landing gear is up:

steps.step: a. Select gear down as required.

steps.text: If message persists and landing gear does not extend:

steps.step: 1. Exit IMC as soon as practicable.

cautions.text: • CAUTION • Air restart may not be possible.

notes.text: • NOTE • Battery FAIL indicates an internal condition which reduces capability of the battery. Possible conditions include a faulty temperature sensor, disconnected heater, etc.

steps.step: b. Service aircraft as soon as practicable.
a. Exit IMC as soon as practicable.
b. Land as soon as practicable.

cautions.text: • CAUTION • Air restart is not possible.

notes.text: • NOTE • Battery FAULT indicates a condition causing battery to disable charging and/or discharging until corrected. Possible conditions include under-voltage, over-voltage, over-current, short-circuit, and over-temperature.

cautionGZ.title: MAIN BUS VOLTS Caution
cautionGZ.description:
Loss of forward main power bus voltage, OR
Main power bus voltage is low.

notes.text: • NOTE • Indicates GEN 1 failure and is associated with low Main Bus voltage, GEN 1 current indications, BAT 1 discharge, and GENERATOR 1 CURRENT Caution.

cautionGZ.title: NO ADC MODES Caution
cautionGZ.description: Autopilot air data modes are not available.

notes.text: • NOTE • AP may only be engaged in pitch modes.

cautionGZ.title: NO VERT MODES Caution
cautionGZ.description: Autopilot vertical modes are not available.

notes.text: • NOTE • AP may only be engaged in lateral modes.

cautionGZ.title: OIL FILTER BYPASS Caution
cautionGZ.description: Oil filter diff press too high, bypass impending.

cautionGZ.title: OXYGEN OFF Caution
cautionGZ.description: Oxygen has not been turned on.

notes.text: • NOTE • This CAS message is displayed during shutdown procedures.

steps.step: 1. Advisory only. No further action required.

notes.text: • NOTE • This CAS message is displayed while taxiing after landing.

cautionGZ.title: OXYGEN PASSENGER FAIL Caution
cautionGZ.description: Passenger oxygen valve has failed closed.

cautions.text: • CAUTION • Complete any emergency descent procedure prior to completing this checklist.

cautionGZ.title: OXYGEN PRESSURE LOW Caution
cautionGZ.description:
Oxygen pressure below regulator control (250 PSI), OR
Oxygen pressure low (500 PSI).

cautions.text: • CAUTION • If OXYGEN PAX CB is pulled, supplemental oxygen to the passengers will be unavailable.

cautionGZ.title: PITCH MET ACTIVE Caution
cautionGZ.description: Pitch manual electric trim is active.

steps.step: 1. Prepare for abnormal pitch movement upon AP disconnect.
2. Perform Pitch Trim Runaway / Failure Checklist.
❑ If ADC 2 is unavailable or if PROBE HEAT FAIL R Caution is also present, and icing encountered:
(a) Perform Loss of Reliable Airspeed Indication Checklist.
❑ If ADC 1 is unavailable or if PROBE HEAT FAIL L Caution is also present, and icing encountered:
(a) Perform Loss of Reliable Airspeed Indication Checklist.

steps.text: If message persists, and icing encountered:

steps.step: b. Perform Loss of Reliable Airspeed Indication checklist.

steps.text: • NOTE • Select PFD mode on GTC #2 or GTC #3 and select SENSORS menu to select PFD air data source.

steps.step: 4. Select correct sensor source, if required.
5. Pull erroneous ADC circuit breaker, if required.
6. Exit IMC as soon as practical.

steps.text: • NOTE • Select PFD mode on GTC #2 or GTC #3 and select SENSORS menu to select PFD air data source.

steps.step: 4. Select correct sensor source, if required.
5. Pull erroneous ADC circuit breaker, if required.
6. Exit IMC as soon as practical.

steps.text: • NOTE • Select PFD mode on GTC #2 or GTC #3 and select SENSORS menu to select PFD attitude source.

steps.step: 4. Select correct sensor source, if required.
5. Pull erroneous AHRS circuit breaker, if required.
6. Exit IMC as soon as practical.

steps.text: • NOTE • Select PFD mode on GTC #2 or GTC #3 and select SENSORS menu to select PFD attitude source.

steps.step: 4. Select correct sensor source, if required.
5. Pull erroneous AHRS circuit breaker, if required.
6. Exit IMC as soon as practical.
2. Avoid stalls, low airspeed, and uncoordinated or abrupt control inputs.

warnings.text:
• WARNING • The aircraft may not be stall protected. Stalls must be avoided when the stall warning is inoperative. Excessive altitude loss may result if the aircraft is stalled.
Departure from controlled flight or spin may occur during stall with uncoordinated aileron/rudder inputs.
Stall warning is not operative or reliable.
Stick pusher may not be operative or reliable.
Expect STICK PUSHER FAIL CAS.
Stall speeds in turns or increased load factor are higher.

notes.text: • NOTE • Green donut airspeed reference will be unavailable or unreliable.

cautionGZ.title: STARTER ENGAGED Caution
cautionGZ.description: Starter will not disengage (start relay stuck).

steps.step: a. From Home, touch Aircraft Systems.
b. Touch the GCU Reset Button.
a. Land as soon as practicable.
2. Avoid stalls, low airspeed, and uncoordinated or abrupt control inputs.

warnings.text:
• WARNING •
The aircraft is not stall protected. Stalls must be avoided when the stick pusher is inoperative. Excessive altitude loss may result if the aircraft is stalled.
Departure from controlled flight or spin may occur during stall with uncoordinated aileron/rudder inputs.
Stick pusher is not operative or reliable.
Stall speeds in turns or increased load factor are higher.

cautionGZ.title: TAKEOFF EMER BAT Caution
cautionGZ.description:
Emergency battery (Bat 2) is not charged.
Emergency battery (Bat 2) is cold.

cautions.text:
• CAUTION •
Engine operating costs are predicated on a maximum of 2 minutes of takeoff thrust on an average flight. Exceeding 5 minutes of takeoff thrust may disproportionately increase engine operating costs. Time at takeoff thrust is limited to 5 minutes maximum, beginning when the thrust lever reaches the T/O thrust detent.

notes.text: Note: No steps were provided for this checklist.

• NOTE •
Autothrottle functions, including thrust lock, will be unavailable.
CAPS activation will require manual retard of thrust lever to IDLE.

cautionGZ.title: WOW FAIL Caution
cautionGZ.description: WOW is indicating on ground state.

warnings.text:
• WARNING •
If above 10,000 ft, expect CABIN ALTITUDE Warning and aircraft to depressurize.

cautions.text:
• CAUTION •
Minimum engine RPM will default to Ground Idle in all configurations. Expect FLIGHT IDLE FAIL Caution with thrust at IDLE thrust in flight.

notes.text:
• NOTE •
Bleed air ground cooling fan will run.
The following indications should be ignored:
• OIL CHIP DETECT Warning (false indication possible if in air)
• OXYGEN ON Advisory
• TAKEOFF PITCH TRIM Advisory

steps.step: a. Limit flaps to 0% or 50% in landing configuration.
b. Perform Flaps Inoperative Approach/Landing checklist.
c. Avoid any unnecessary maneuvers during flight. Limit maneuvers only to those necessary to safely land the aircraft.

normalProcedures.title: Before Engine Start
normalProcedures.description: Ensure all pre-engine start procedures are completed.

steps.action: AS NEEDED SET 28 VDC, 800 A (MINIMUM), 1000 A (MAXIMUM)

steps.step: Verify active FADEC channel is displayed below % thrust indication.

normalProcedures.title: Engine Start
normalProcedures.description: Checklist for initiating engine start procedures.

steps.step: a. Verify FUEL PUMP ON Advisory CAS is displayed.
b. Audibly confirm pump is ON.
Verify ENGINE START BAT TEMP or ENGINE START VOLTS CAS message is not displayed.

notes.text:
• CAUTION • At 25% N2, ensure positive N1 indication.
Be prepared to abort start. If any of the following occur, abort start:
• ITT exceeds limits (red line).
• No N1 indication by 25% N2.
• No evidence of lightoff within 8 seconds.
• Low oil pressure after start.
• NOTE • The BLEED switch should not be set to BLEED until BAT 1 and BAT 2 have been ON for 2 minutes or more.

steps.step: 12. Seats must be in normal upright position.
9. Verify TAKEOFF EMER BAT CAS message is not displayed.

steps.action: UP AT 115 KIAS, CLEAR OF OBSTACLES

steps.step: 2. All seats must be in normal upright position.

steps.action: UP w/ POSITIVE RATE OF CLIMB
UP AT 115 KIAS, CLEAR OF OBSTACLES
